title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX little changed as banks, resource shares rise
text: February 28, 2018 / 2:45 PM / Updated 9 minutes ago CANADA STOCKS-TSX little changed as banks, resource shares rise Reuters Staff 1 Min Read Feb 28 (Reuters) - Canada’s main stock index opened little changed on Wednesday as gains in shares of natural resource companies and banks were offset by a drop in Valeant Pharmaceuticals after it gave a weaker-than-expected revenue forecast. * At 9:37 a.m. ET (14:37 GMT), the Toronto Stock Exchange’s S&P/TSX composite index was up 17.08 points, or 0.11 percent, at 15,688.23. (Reporting by Leah Schnurr Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
